Price for basic Piano tuning. A basic piano tuning fee is $125. If the pitch of the piano is low to the point it needs extra work, pitch changes are $65. Customers with pianos that have not been tuned recently should expect a piano tuning fee between $125 and $190.

Most tunings will take around 1 hour to one-and-a-half. Average cost in the U.S. is about $100 per hour. As with every specialty field however, there are individuals who stand out. For a very experienced tuner with a sterling reputation, $150 to even $200 an hour is not unheard of. Generally though, technicians that skilled are only called on when someone has a very expensive instrument such as a Nord Stage 2 SW73 or large Grand Piano.

To tune the piano to concert pitch: The standard fee alone applies to most well maintained pianos. Add $45 to a standard tuning fee for pianos that are up to 1/4 tone flat/sharp. This can be done in one visit. Double the standard tuning fee for pianos that are between 1/4 and 2/3 tone flat (2 visits). Pianos that are more than 2/3 tone flat may require additional pitch raisings at $45 each. If you have a tuning device, like a guitar tuner, you may be able to test the piano’s pitch yourself.

2. Tuning prices vary widely according to cost of living in the geographical area, the experience the tuner has, and how much in demand they are. A recent survey of tuning prices across the country indicated a range of from $50. to over $200. The average currently seems to run from around $75 to 125.

A piano can cost anywhere from $3,000 to more than $100,000, depending on the brand, size and the age of the piano. A quality digital piano starts around $2,000. Upright pianos start around $3,000 and grand pianos start around $5,000 for quality used pianos. New piano price ranges are slightly higher.

How much does it cost to tune a piano? –. When Russell makes a tuning call visit, he may need to tune your piano 1 time, 2 times or 3 times during that SAME visit depending upon the condition of the piano. Your tuning cost may be $99.00, or $124.00, or $159.00 for that day's tuning service.

Where I live, standard tuning is $90.00, give or take. In LA, I have heard that $150.00 is the going rate. Also, a piano that is badly out of tune (hasn't been tuned for at least 5 years) will cost more to tune because it needs what's known as a pitch raise.
